content.text:
# Broadbarred king mackerel

| taxon = Scomberomorus semifasciatus
| authority = Macleay, 1883
| synonyms =
}}
The broadbarred king mackerel or grey mackerel (Scomberomorus semifasciatus) is a species of fish in the family Scombridae found in tropical waters of the western Pacific, along the northern coast of Australia and the southern coast of Papua New Guinea, from Shark Bay, Western Australia to northern New South Wales, in waters from the surface down to 100 m (330 ft). Specimens have been recorded at up to  in length, and weighing up to . They are pelagic predators, feeding on small fishes such as sardines and herring.
See also
* Mackerel as food
